CatDescriptText: Mr. McNeal Stewart Jr., gas station attendant, 700 Herron Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 12, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the President of the United States should intervene in steel strike, or should he wait, and then invoke the 80-day 'cooling off' period as prescribed in the Taft-Hartley Act?" answer reads: "I think he should speak up, because I believe he could be the one to settle the strike."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of McNeal Stewart Jr. wearing dark button down collared shirt with rolled up sleeves, standing against light colored wall between windows
